intro: Ornithogalum bicolor, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulb, which stores nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in traditional medicine.
